featured.text: One might think that somewhere a genius thought up the first potato chips, but it didn’t happen that way.
The potato chips have been left uncovered on the table for such a long time that they no longer taste fresh and _____.
In the 1920s a mechanical potato peeler was invented and soon there were potato chips in abundance.
The restaurant started selling small packages of the potato chips.

other.text: Therefore, potato chips are worse than candy because they get stuck between teeth.

The junk varies from tiny pieces of paint chipped off rockets to cameras, huge fuel tanks, and even odd items like the million-dollar tool kit that astronaut Heidemarie Stefanyshyn-Piper lost during a spacewalk.
According to this passage, mass production of potato chips was made possible when ________.
Potato chips have been popular in the U.S. _______.

definition.zh_def: 一小片薄片，通常由木材、塑料或金屬製成，或指計算機中的微小電路元件。
definition.en_def: A small piece of material, often made of wood, plastic, or metal, or a small electronic circuit component in computers.
definition.example: He added a chip of wood to the fire to keep it burning.
